subject: Re: [junit] Re: Help w/"JUnit Best Practices" Program from JavaWorld
msgSnippet: ... Use a correct classpath.  Junit doesn t require any changes to a properly defined application classpath beyond adding JUnit itself to the application
messageBody:
On Fri, 9 Mar 2001 ghouston@... wrote:

> > I just downloaded this and tried it out.
> >
> > I get that message when my classpath is incomplete. It's
> unfortunate
> > that the bp package doesn't name the class it couldn't load.
> Basically,
> > that bp classpath should contain everything your own applcation's
> classpath
> > contains, in addition to junit and bp itself.
>
> Is there a way to modify the bp code so you don't have to change your
> classpath?

Use a correct classpath. Junit doesn't require any changes to
a properly defined application classpath beyond adding JUnit itself
to the application classpath. Bp is just a front-end for JUnit.
